title: El Tiempo Cantina’s margarita for a cause

( Nick de la Torre / Chronicle ) Photo: Nick De La Torre, Staff Image 23 of 23 El Tiempo Cantina’s margarita for a cause 1 / 23 Back to Gallery Drink a margarita; help a firefighter. It's a concept as simple as that.
Starting Nov. 2, El Tiempo Cantina restaurants will participate in a year-long fundraising effort to benefit Firefighters Helping Firefighters . Just order a Station 20 Five-Alarm Rita, $13 each, and El Tiempo will donate $1 from each to the charity that was created after the tragic Southwest Inn Fire in 2013.
The high-end margarita – made with premium Titanium tequila, pineapple juice, passion fruit and jalapeno – was created by Andrea Winters, wife of Wade Winters, a firefighter at Station 20, across the street from El Tiempo's Navigation store.
Owner and executive chef Domenic Laurenzo said that in addition to the margarita promotion, El Tiempo restaurants will continue to offer all police, firefighters, ambulance attendees and military personnel in official uniform (or with official ID) a 50 percent discount on the food portion of their meals.
